meanings.definition: To expose too much to light or radiation.
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to overexpose your film to sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The photographer accidentally overexposed the photo, making it too bright.
meanings.sent3: He always manages to overexpose his vacation pictures, making everyone look like ghosts.
meanings.sent4: Her skin was so fair that the sun seemed to overexpose it instantly.
meanings.sent5: The flashlight was so strong that it overexposed everything in the room.

meanings.definition: To reveal too much information or details.
meanings.sent1: I didn't mean to overexpose our plans to everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: The journalist decided not to overexpose the confidential documents.
meanings.sent3: She tends to overexpose her personal life on social media, much to her friends' amusement.
meanings.sent4: His speech overexposed the company's future strategy, causing chaos among the employees.
meanings.sent5: The detective accidentally overexposed the suspect's alibi during the interrogation.

meanings.definition: To make excessively visible or prominent.
meanings.sent1: The bright neon sign overexposed the small shop on the corner.
meanings.sent2: The makeup artist didn't want to overexpose the model's natural beauty.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's loud outfit overexposed his quirky sense of humor.
meanings.sent4: The spotlight overexposed the singer's nervousness on stage.
meanings.sent5: The new camera settings accidentally overexposed the details in the background.
